This statistic shows the total annual expenditure on household appliances in the United Kingdom from 2005 to 2019, based on volume. In 2019, UK households purchased approximately 11 billion British pounds worth of household appliances.
Iowa has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1848, and has correctly voted for the winning candidate in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. In the 1892 election, Iowa's only election was contested between James A. Garfield and Rutherford B. Hayes, and the Republican nominee, Donald Trump. Since 1872, Iowa has voted for a major party candidate in every election except 1964, and in the 2020 election, Republican nominee Donald Trump won the popular vote in the state with 306 electoral votes.

This statistic shows the annual disposable income in Belgium from 2000 to 2010 (in euros). Disposable income is defined as the amount of money a family has available to buy, plus expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), plus net receipts of primary income. In 2010, the disposable income of a Belgian household amounted to 40,502 euros.

North Carolina has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1792, and has correctly voted for the nationwide winner in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. North Carolina has always voted for a major party candidate, and in the past forty elections, North Carolina's electors have generally voted for either the more conservative option of the major party candidates. The only times where North Carolina did not take part in the 2020 election were in 1856 and 1872, where the Pine Tree State voted for an unaffiliated candidate; this was due to the McCaskey Rebellion in the 1850s, and

GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per capita In Paraguay amounted to around 5,425.9 U.S. dollars.

It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2017, Madagascar's gross domestic domestic product amounted to around 46.31 billion international dollars.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Lesotho from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Lesothotho population was 23 years.

This statistic shows the average inflation rate in Denmark from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in Denmark amounted to about 0.73 percent compared to the previous year.
At the end of fiscal year 2019, the IT and IT services, electronics, hardware, semiconductors sector accounted for 58 percent of Special Economic Zones in India. This sector was followed by the manufacturing sector at five percent.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Panama between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of equality. As of 2017, Panama had an index of 49.9, an improvement from 51.9 as of 2012.

The index is a composite indicator that includes data on the happiness of individuals living in a country, divided by the number of people living in the country or living in an urban setting. The highest possible score in happiness is 0, whereas a score of 10 indicates that no happiness is possible in China.

This statistic shows the number of households in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2019, by type and number of occupants. In 2019, there were approximately 7.98 million 'one person' households, consisting of two or more unrelated adults.
This statistic shows the population growth in the BRIC countries from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the population of Brazil grew by approximately 0.75 percent compared to the previous year.
This statistic shows the average inflation rate in Belgium from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in Belgium amounted to about 1.25 percent compared to the previous year.
The highest number of manual scavenger deaths in Indian states between January 1993 and January 2020 was recorded in the western state of All India. The south Asian country ranked first out of 200 reported in World Road Statistics that year for the number of deaths caused by manual scavengers.
The statistic displays the literacy rate in rural and urban regions of Karnataka in India in 2011, with a breakdown by gender. The literacy rate among males living in rural areas in Karnataka was around 78 percent in 2011. India's literacy rate from 1981 through 2011 can be found here.
In 2019, the median household income in Utah amounted to 88,523 U.S. dollars. This is a slight increase from the previous year, when the median income in the state amounted to 77,6767 dollars.
This statistic shows the results of a survey asking football clubs in the United Kingdom (UK) if they expect to make a profit before and/or after player trading and amortization in their next accounting period. The majority of respondents (69 percent) believed that they expected to make profit before player trading.
This statistic shows the proportion of women remaining childless in England and Wales, by year of birth (cohorts) as of 2016. In 1920, 21 percent of all women who gave birth to a child were childless. By 1971, this share had dropped to 18 percent.
This statistic shows the number of tourists in South Africa from 2012 to 2023. In 2023, it is estimated that 19.6 million tourists will visit South Africa, an increase from 14.16 million tourists in 2012.
The statistic shows the youth unemployment rate in Azerbaijan from 1999 and 2020. According to the source, the data are ILO estimates. In 2020, the estimated data rate at the end of 2020 was at 15.69 percent.
This statistic shows the degree of urbanization in South Africa from 2009 to 2019. Urbanization means the share of urban population in the total population of a country. In 2019, 66.86 percent of South Africa's total population lived in urban areas and cities.
In 2019, Nigerian e-commerce platform Jumia generated a gross merchandise volume (GMV) of approximately 1.09 billion euros, up from 828.2 million euros in the previous year.
The statistic shows the leading 20 countries worldwide based on mortality rate attributed to unintentional poisoning in 2016. In that year, Burundi was ranked first with an estimated 5.2 unintentional poisoning deaths per 100,000 inhabitants.
This statistic displays the annual consumption volume of bananas in Austria from 2008/09 to 2018/19. In the period of consideration, the volume fluctuated, peaking in 2009/10 at approximately 102.5 thousand tonnes. In 2018/2019 the volume amounted to approximately 112.8 thousand tonnes, a decrease of roughly 0.4 percent in comparison with the previous year.
The statistic shows the youth unemployment rate in Uruguay from 1999 and 2020. According to the source, the data are ILO estimates. In 2020, the estimated data rate at the end of 2020 was at 27.1 percent.
This statistic displays the global death rates for the leading causes of deaths among adolescents aged 15 to 19 years in 2015. In that year, the death rate for road injury was 14.4 deaths per 100,000 population worldwide.
As of March 2020, 73 percent of Italian respondents stated that they would not be able to work from home at the moment due to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic. Moreover, 23 percent of interviewees indicated that they already have a home office, while three percent of them already have an office.  For further information about the pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

This statistic shows the average annual household expenditure on make-up, skin care and manicure products in Canada from 2010 to 2017. In 2017, the average Canadian household spent approximately 264 Canadian dollars on these products.

It can be seen that the first-time buyer scheme had a gross advances of 18.15 percent during the second quarter of 2020.
This statistic shows the number of bank branches in France from 2016 to 2020, by bank. It shows that the Caisse d'Épargne bank represented the largest bank branch in France in 2020, with 4,200 branches. It was followed by Banque Populaire with 3,124 branches.
The statistic shows the value of the distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) protection and mitigation market worldwide in 2018 and 2023. In 2018, the global DDoS protection market was valued at 1.94 billion U.S. dollars.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among American parents regarding the importance of technology to student success. In 2012, 42 percent of surveyed parents stated that the use of technology was extremely important.
The statistic shows the infant mortality rate in Yemen from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the estimated infant mortality in Yemen was at about 43.6 deaths per 1,000 live births.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among American adults on their least favorite Olympic event. 13 percent of respondents stated that they would rather watch the equestrian event than the badminton event.
This statistic shows the number of enterprises in the manufacture of plastics products industry in Sweden from 2008 to 2017. In 2017, there were 1,94 enterprises manufacturing plastics products in Sweden.
This statistic shows the results of a survey on the impact of terrorism on people's travel plans in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2019. During the survey period, 47.6 percent of respondents stated that the fear of terrorism affected their travel plans.
In 2019, approximately 12 percent of the population in Singapore were aged up to 14 years old. This was a slight increase from the previous year, when the share of children in Singapore amounted to 12 percent.

According to the data, 58.9 percent of respondents stated that they received information about suicide prevention.

The statistic illustrates the inflation rate for the Retail Price Index (RPI) in the United Kingdom (UK) from 1948 to November 2020. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In November 2020, the RPI inflation rate was 0.9 percent.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Bhutan from 1985 to 2015, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the estimated GDP per capita of Bhutan amounted to around 3,356.78 U.S. dollars.

In 2019, Somalia was perceived to be the most corrupt country in the world, with a corruption index score of nine out of ten. South Sudan and Syria were ranked second and third, respectively. Corruption perception index is a measure of public perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of governments' anti-corruption efforts. A score of 0 indicates high perceptions of corruption, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country.

The infant mortality rate in China, for children under the age of one year old, was 195 deaths per thousand births in 1950. This means that for all babies born in 1950, approximately one in every thousand did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, and the rate has dropped to its lowest point ever in 2020 where it is just ten deaths per one thousand births.
During the first week of March 2020, the sales of selected fruit and vegetables in the United States fell by 18.7 percent compared to the previous year. For further information about the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
In 2018, the adolescent fertility rate in Sri Lanka amounted to 20.69 births per thousand women. This was a decrease from 2009, in which there were approximately 20.48 births per 1,000 women.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Guatemala from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the unemployment in Guatemala was at approximately 2.51 percent.
This statistic presents the results of a public opinion survey carried out in Chile in 2017. When asked which type of transport they used, approximately 83 percent of respondents claimed to be using a metro or small bus.
This statistic shows the advertising revenue of Google network websites from 2001 to 2019. In the most recently reported fiscal year, Google's advertising revenue amounted to 21.55 billion U.S. dollars, up from 20.01 billion a year earlier.
This statistic shows the most popular leisure activities among adults in the United States as of September 2013. During the survey, 19 percent of respondents stated spending time with family and friends as a favorite leisure activity.
The statistic presents the pre-tax earnings of Goldman Sachs from 2009 to 2019. Goldman Sachs is one of the largest banks in the United States. In 2019, Goldman Sachs earned approximately 2.58 billion U.S. dollars after tax.

By contrast, just four percent of Brits said that they thought the government was taking the crisis seriously enough.  The latest number of cases in the UK can be found here. This statistic illustrates the value of venture capital invested in healthtech companies in the United States from 2014 to 2020. Private equity is the OTC provision of equity capital through private or institutional investments with the participation of companies in another company for a limited time in order to generate financial benefits. It can be seen that total private equity investments fluctuated overall during the period under observation, reaching a value of some 7.8 billion U.S. dollars as of 2019. The largest total value of private equity investment was found in 2017, when venture capital investment of 5.5 billion U-S. dollar was recorded.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in Democratic Republic of the Congo from 1984 to 2018, with projections up until 2021. Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, Democratic Republic Of the Congo's gross domestic profit amounted to around 78.3 billion international dollars.

India confirmed over 9.9 million cases of the coronavirus (COVID-19) as of December 17, 2020, with over 10 million recoveries. The country went into lockdown on March 25, the largest in the world, restricting 1.3 billion people and extended until May 3, 2020. The lockdown was enforced due to the growing number of people who were infected with the virus.  India went into a lockdown on April 25, a so-called "Janata Curfew" because of the spread of the virus, announced by the World Health Organization on March 24. The government had announced a nationwide lockdown

The impact of the coronavirus (COVID-19) on software spending worldwide is still unknown. However, according to a survey conducted in March 2020, 23 percent of IT and computer software companies said that they are planning to spend more on marketing and advertising in 2020, while a further 22 percent said they are going to spend less.

In the period under consideration, the transport volume of freight by rail in Spain presented a trend of growth. In 2018, the total amount of freight transported by rail amounted to approximately 10.8 billion ton-miles.

The country's national electric grid had an installed capacity of approximately 364 gigawatts as of October 2019. This statistic shows the ifo Economic Climate for the euro area from the fourth quarter of 2017 to the 4th quarter of 2019. The ifo economic climate measures the change in the price level of finished products (consumer goods, capital goods). The indicator is adjusted for price changes and is therefore regarded as a key indicator for the economic strength of a country. It measures changes in the purchasing power of a currency. In the first quarter of 2018, the GDP of the euro amounted to 43.2 billion U.S. dollars.

The fertility rate of a country is the average number of children that women from that country will have throughout their reproductive years. In Germany, the fertility rate was 5.4 children per woman in 1800, and over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, particularly in the first half of the twentieth century, and it is expected to fall to 1.59 in 2020. The only time where Germany's fertility rate increased during this 220 year period was in the Second World War, where the rate dropped from 4.7 to 2.7.

After the first wave of infections in the beginning of April, the number of clubs closed by May 1 decreased by 38.9 percent compared to the same month in the previous year. The statistic shows the average inflation rate in Ireland from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in Ireland amounted to about 0.88 percent compared to the previous year.

The Battle of Stones River was one of the largest and bloodiest battles of the American Civil War. The battle took place between the Union and the Confederacy during the second half of the 1864, and was fought between General Robert E. Lee's Confederate forces, and the Union's Army of Virginia, commanded by General John Pope. Pope's union troops were driven from the defensive position by Major General Thomas J. 'Stonewall' Jackson, and Jackson then held the position for some time, before Jackson then retreated with his men. Stones River is the only point in the history of the war where the Union did not

Lee's Confederate forces were attacked by the Union forces, and captured by the Confederate forces. After a week of heavy bombardment from the Union, Lee's men were eventually able to re-take the city, and the Union's forces were driven back by Major General Thomas E. McClellan, who then used artillery to besiege the city. As a result, the city was one of the most important defensive targets for the Union during the

The Battle took place as a result of General Robert E. Lee's attack on the Union's Major General George B. McClellan's Confederate forces, and his attempt to besiege the city by the end of the month. This statistic presents the Corruption Perception Index score obtained by Uruguay from 2012 to 2019. This index is a composite indicator that includes data on the perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of governments' anti-corruption efforts. The highest possible score in perception of Corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country. In Uruguay, the corruption perception index score increased from 70 points in 2018 to 71 points in 2019.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in Comoros from 1985 to 2018, with projections up until 2025. Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, Comoros' gross domestic domestic product amounted to around 1.18 billion U.S. dollars.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in Honduras from 1984 to 2018, with projections up until 2021. Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, Honduras' gross domestic domestic product amounted to around 49.2 billion international dollars.

The most common cause of death in Sweden in 2019 was diseases of the circulatory system. The number of deaths amounted to 28,195 in 2019. The second leading cause was neoplasms, accounting for 23,453 deaths. Diseases of the respiratory system ranked third, with 6,154 deaths.

According to a survey carried out in Mexico in 2019, sexual harassment was the most important issue faced by women and girls, with 40 percent of women and 37 percent of men answering that sexual violence was their main concern. Physical violence and domestic abuse were the second and third most important issues, with 32 and 19 percent of the women and women interviewed, respectively.

Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, Romania’s GDP amounted to around 549.2 billion international dollars.

In 2019, about 6.55 million families were living below the poverty line in the United States.  Poverty is the state of one who lacks a certain amount of material possessions or money. Absolute poverty or destitution is inability to afford basic human needs, which commonly includes clean and fresh water, nutrition, health care, education, clothing and shelter.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Azerbaijan from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median population of Azerbaijan was 30.3 years.
This statistic shows the total number of self-employed in the United Kingdom (UK) from July 2018 to June 2019, by major occupational group. Self-employed are those who are temporarily absent from their regular jobs because of illness, work or various personal reasons. The largest occupational group was those in skilled trades, with a total of over 1.1 million selfemployed.

Bulgaria's population grew gradually throughout the nineteenth century, from just under seven million people in 1800, to over seven million in the early 1900s. After the First World War, Bulgaria became a part of the Ottoman Empire and the Bulgarian Empire until the Second World War. During this time, Bulgaria's population increased gradually, reaching approximately 7.5 million people by 1900, before falling again in the late 1910s, and reaching its lowest point ever in 2020 where it was just under 6.7 million people.

The Great Smallpox Pandemic of 1870 to 1871 was one of the most widespread and widespread pandemics of all time. Although smallpox was confined to the smallpox-influenced regions of Europe until the late 1870s, it was in the Netherlands where it was the second largest pandemic, and in Scotland where smallpox became endemic to the nineteenth century. The virus then spread to all corners of Europe, and was responsible for the deaths of over 60 percent of all Europeans.

In November 2020, due to the outbreak of the coronavirus (COVID-19) in Poland, the air operations of major airports in Poland decreased by 90 percent compared to the same month in the previous year. The most significant decrease was recorded at the major airports Gdańsk, Krakow, Katowice, Modlin, Poznań, Rzeszów, Warszawa, Wrocław, and Warszaw.

The largest amount of consumer lending was found in credit cards, with a value amounting to approximately 2.23 billion British British pounds.

The child mortality rate in Portugal, for children under the age of five, was 372 deaths per thousand births in 1890. This means that approximately one in every three children born in 1890 did not make it to their fifth birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, particularly in the first half of the twentieth century, and the rate has dropped to its lowest point ever in 2020 where it is just three deaths every thousand births.

This statistic shows the Net International Investment Position (NIIP) of the Netherlands from 2006 to 2018 (as share of GDP). It shows that the net international investment position is a measurement of a country’s Gross Domestic Product (GDP). The NIIP is calculated as the difference between the amount of money paid by Dutch residents abroad and the amount paid out by Dutch citizens abroad. In 2018, the Netherlands' net international Investment Position amounted to approximately 70.7 percent of the GDP.

This statistic shows the Salmonella rate in the United States as of 2018, by state. As of that year, the state of Mississippi had the highest rate of salmonella with 39.8 new cases per 100,000 population.
Life expectancy in Spain was 29.5 in the year 1880, and over the course of the next 145 years, it is expected to have increased to 83.4 by the year 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Spain's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were because of the Spanish Flu Pandemic of the late-1910s, and the Spanish Civil War of the Second World War.

The statistic depicts the median age of the population in Italy from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Italian population was 45.4 years.

As of July 2020, the inflation rate in the Netherlands was 1.1 percent compared to the same month in the previous year. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Panama from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the GDP per person in Panama amounted to around 15,834.04 U.S. dollars.

In the nineteenth century, Greece's population grew from approximately 8.5 million people in 1821, to approximately 10.4 million in the early 1900s, before falling again in the 1910s and 1920s. During this time, Greece was one of the most powerful and influential countries in the world, and Greece was among the countries with the largest population in Europe. In the early years of the twentieth century however, the population of Greece fluctuated greatly, and by the end of the 1800s it had been estimated that there were approximately 11.7 million people living in Greece, and this was the peak recorded since the

This statistic shows the results of a survey among adult Americans on their attitude towards LGBT demands. During the survey, 44 percent of homosexual respondents stated that they were in favor of civil partnerships for heterosexual and homosexual couples.
This statistic shows the harmonized consumer price index for all items in Croatia from October 2017 to September 2018. In September 2018, the HICP increased to 102.96 points.
This statistic shows the uranium mine production in the United States from 2003 to 2019. In 2019, the U.S. uranium production amounted to 67 metric tons.

This statistic displays the total healthcare expenditure per capita in the Netherlands from 1998 to 2019 (in euros). It shows that in 2019, the total amount spent per capita on healthcare was approximately 6,120 euros.
This statistic presents the locations where women in Chile reported having been sexually harassed in 2017. When asked which were the places where they reported having suffered from sexual harassment, 23 percent of female respondents from Chile said that they had been harassed in a social environment.

This statistic shows the number of executions in the United States from 1976 to 2020, by method of execution. In 2020, 163 executions were carried out by electrocution.

This statistic shows the percentage turnout of registered voters in the European elections in France from 1979 to 2019. The highest turnout was registered in 1979, when 60.71 percent of the French population voted.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Spain from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the average age in Spain was 42.5 years.
This statistic shows the number of companies trading on the London Stock Exchange (SEE) from January 2015 to November 2020. As of November 2020, there were a total of 2,988 companies trading. The majority of companies traded on the SSE.
This statistic presents the informal employment as percentage of total employment in Bolivia from 2011 to 2018. Informal employment is defined as the share of employment in a given country, which is an indicator of the economic strength of a country. In 2018, the percentage of informal employment reported in Bolivia amounted to 80.7 percent, down from 79.12 percent a year earlier.

The statistic shows the average inflation rate in India from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in India amounted to about 4.76 percent compared to the previous year.

It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015,the median age the population of Zambia was 16.7 years.
The cumulative number of coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in Russia amounted to over 3.9 million as of December 26, 2020, with over 4.2 million active cases and over 5.6 million deaths. The highest number of cases was recorded in the country at over 2.7 million, while the number of deaths was higher in the Russian capital, Moscow.
In a pessimistic scenario, the Russian gross domestic product (GDP) was estimated to decrease by four percent in 2020 and 2021, in comparison to the previous year. In the case of the second COVID-19 pandemic, the GDP growth was expected to be measured at minus six percent. In a more positive scenario, it was estimated at 1.5 percent. Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, Iceland’s GDP amounted to around 19.33 billion international dollars.

GDP refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year. It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. Real GDP is adjusted for price changes and is therefore regarded as a key indicator for economic growth. In 2020, India's real GDP fell by around 10.29 percent compared to the previous year.

The world records for men and women are set at 4.85 meters by Bulgaria's Vladimir Stojković in 1988, and 4.09 meters by Russia's Yelen Kostadov in 1992. South Korea confirmed 30,017 cases of infection including 501 deaths. The country went into lockdown on March 25, the largest in the world, restricting 1.3 billion people, and extended until May 3, 2020. For further information about the coronavidus (SARS-CoV-2) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Kuwait from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median population of Kuwait was 33.5 years.

This statistic shows the total amount of money raised by super PACs and other PACs supporting the candidate in the 2016 U.S. presidential election, by supported candidate, as of June 22, 2016. Super PACs are independent expenditure-only committees, which may raise unlimited sums of money from corporations, unions, associations and individuals, then spend unlimited sums to overtly advocate for or against political candidates. However, direct coordination and communication between political candidates and super PACs is prohibited.

This statistic shows the global metastatic cancer treatment market in 2017 and 2025. In 2017, the global market for metastatic cancers was valued at 54.1 billion U.S. dollars. It is estimated that the market will increase to 98.2 billion dollars by 2025.
Husqvarna AB was the leading company in Jänköping county, Sweden, as of February 2020, by turnover. The company generated a turnover of over 41 billion Swedish kronor. Liljedahl Group AB ranked second, with a turnover amounting to around 12.3 billion kroner.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among adult Americans on their belief in God. 48 percent of respondents stated to believe in God, while 52 percent stated to be against it.
This statistic shows the monthly amount of cars sold by MG in the United Kingdom (UK) between July 2014 and December 2019. Peaks in registration numbers were recorded in March and September of each year, which was due to the issuing of license plates by the Driver & Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) in those months. In December 2019, MG sold 1,022 cars.

As of January 3, 2020, Austria reported 357,963 confirmed cases of coronavirus (COVID-19). The highest number of daily confirmed cases in the country was recorded in the city of Wuhan. The first case in Austria was confirmed on 4 March. Since then, the number of cases has been increasing steadily.
In 2020, Chile scored 0.61 in the gender gap index in the area of economic participation and opportunity, which means that women are 35 percent less likely to have equal economic participation or opportunities than men. That same year, Chile's estimated earned income amounted to 0.56, which shows a gender pay gap of approximately 38 percent (on average, women's income was estimated to be 38 percent lower than men's).
This statistic depicts the prevalence of type 1 diabetes in the U.S. from 2007 to 2020. In 2020, the prevalence was estimated at 0.2 percent. Type 1 diabetes is a type of diabetes that causes high blood sugar levels.

Life expectancy in Italy was 29.69 in the year 1870, and over the course of the next 145 years, it is expected to have increased to 83.3 by the year 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Italy's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were because of the Spanish Flu pandemic of the late-1910s, and the Second World War.

In 2018, about 67 percent of households in Tamil Nadu had exclusive access to toilets, while 21.5 percent had no access to any kind of toilets. These results come from the 76th NSO survey conducted between July and December 2018, which found over 20 percent of private households across the country without any access to the toilets.  One of the goals of the Swachh Bharat Abhiyan, a clean India campaign launched by the Modi government, aimed to eliminate open defecation in the country by building toilets. Since 2014, 80 million toilets were built, making 419 districts in the nation free from open def

The largest difference between present-day borders and former borders occurred in the early nineteenth century, when the population was much smaller than before the Great Depression, and again in the 1910s, as a result of the Spanish Flu pandemic.

Gross domestic product or GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. The infant mortality rate in Canada, for children under the age of one year old, was 187 deaths per thousand births in 1900. This means that for all babies born in 1900, approximately one in every three did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, and the rate has dropped to just five in 2020.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Somalia from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Somali population was 16.2 years.

This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Bolivia between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of equality. As of 2017, Bolivia had an index of 44, an improvement from 56.3 as of 2012.

For further information about the coronavus (Slovenia) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
In 1925, the fertility rate of Algeria was 6.99 children per woman. This means that for every woman born in 1925, approximately seven children would have been born in that year. Over the next 25 years, this number dropped drastically, reaching it's lowest point ever in 2020 where it was just 3.05. Algeria's fertility rate dropped drastically after the Second World War, as a result of the First World War and the economic depression that followed. After the war, Algeria experienced its first baby boom, before falling again in the late 1960s.
This timeline depicts North Carolina's imports and exports of goods from January 2017 to May 2020. In May 2020, the value of North Carolina’s imports amounted to about 4.9 billion U.S. dollars; its exports valued about 1.7 billion dollars that month.
This statistic shows the results of a survey among adult Americans on stalking. 76.8 percent of respondents aged 18 to 24 stated that they have been victim of stalking.
According to a survey carried out in Mexico in March 2020, the number of visits to shopping malls and stores in the country decreased by 71 percent when compared to the same month a year earlier. Moreover, 63 percent of respondents stated that they were going to visit shopping malls in the future due to the COVID-19 pandemic. This statistic shows the average inflation rate in Luxembourg from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in Luxembourg amounted to about 1.65 percent compared to the previous year.

The statistic depicts the median age of the population in Nepal from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median population of Nepal was 22.2 years.

The statistic shows South Africa's real gross domestic product (GDP) growth rate from 2015 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. Real GDP is adjusted for price changes and is therefore regarded as a sign of economic strength. In 2019, South Africa’s real GDP increased by around 0.15 percent compared to the previous year.

This statistic presents the Corruption Perception Index score obtained by El Salvador from 2012 to 2019. This index is a composite indicator that includes data on the perception of corruption in areas such as: bribery of public officials, kickbacks in public procurement, embezzlement of state funds, and effectiveness of governments' anti-corruption efforts. The highest possible score in perception of Corruption is 0, whereas a score of 100 indicates that no corruption is perceived in the respective country. In El Salvador, the corruption perception index score increased from 35 points in 2018 to 34 points in 2019.

As of the third quarter of 2020, 19 percent of internet users in the United States aged 15 to 25 years used WhatsApp. Only 13 percent of U.S. internet users aged 56 years and older used the messaging app.
This statistic shows the amount of money spent by German travellers abroad from 2006 to 2019. In 2019, 82.7 million euros were spent by Germans on travel overseas.
This statistic displays the quantity of brassicacea (including cabbage and broccoli) consumed per day in the United Kingdom between 2008 and 2012, by age. In this four year period, individuals aged between 19 and 64 years old consumed 21 grams of brassicanacea per day.
This statistic shows the number of student, staff, and non-student school-associated violent deaths in the United States from 1992 to 2017. In the school year 2016-17, there were 42 violent deaths.
This statistic provides a comparison of the average amount of time spent on sport and exercise by gender in OECD member countries as well as China, India and South Africa. As of 2016, women in South Africa spent an average of 25 minutes per day on sport/exercising.
This statistic shows U.S. lower- and middle-income consumer spending from July 2016 to July 2017, by month. The data are from the American Economic Forum and are based on publicly available sources such as the Congressional Budget Office, the American League of Economic Co-operation and Development, and Simmons National Consumer Survey (NCCSS). The monthly spending of the lower-middle class Americans amounted to 80 U. S. dollars in July 2017.
This statistic shows the age structure in Thailand from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, about 16.82 percent of Thailand's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.
This statistic displays the average annual salary in the Caribbean Netherlands from 2011 to 2017 (in U.S. dollars). It shows that between 2011 and 2017, the average salary increased from 22,330 to 26,110 dollars.
The weekly number of coronavirus (COVID-19) tests in Sweden increased significantly during the period from January to December 2020. As of December 11, 2020, the total number of tests amounted to nearly 268 thousand. The number of confirmed cases in Sweden was higher than the number of deaths in the country.  The first case of the virus in Sweden  was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronavus (SARS-CoV-2) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

At the end of fiscal year 2019, Karnataka Bank Limited had a credit to deposit ratio of 80.1 percent. This was a decrease from the previous fiscal year, when the bank had a CD ratio of 75.16 percent. The CD ratio is an important first indication to gauge a bank's health. A very high CD ratio indicates pressure on resources, while a very low CD ratio can mean that the bank is not using its available resources optimally.

The infant mortality rate in Norway, for children under the age of one year old, was 140 deaths per thousand births in 1840. This means that for all babies born in 1840, over 140 did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, particularly in the first half of the twentieth century, and the rate has dropped to its lowest point ever in 2020 where it is just two deaths per million births.

It can be seen that this percentage fluctuated during the period under observation, reaching a peak of 67.04 percent in 2011.

This statistic represents the global end use of zinc as of 2017, by category. In that year, some six percent of the end uses of zinc worldwide came from the manufacture of chemicals.
This graph depicts the value of the Milwaukee Brewers franchise of Major League Baseball from 2002 to 2020. In 2020, the franchise had an estimated value of 1.2 billion U.S. dollars. The Milwaukee Brewers are owned by John Henry and Thomas Werner, who bought the franchise for 450 million dollars in 2002.
The highest number of confirmed coronavirus (COVID-19) cases in Norway as of November 26, 2020 was in the county of Oslo, with 10,934 cases. By comparison, the number of cases in Troms og Finnmark amounted to 629.
This statistic shows the number of same-sex marriages in Norway from 2009 to 2019. During the time period under consideration, the highest number was recorded in 2009, when 283 same sex marriages were registered. In 2019, there were 331 same- sex marriages.
This statistic shows the reasons that ethical products make consumers LESS likely to buy products that are produced in an ethical way in the United Kingdom (UK) in 2015. Of respondents, 39 percent said ethical products tend to have higher prices and 33 percent said information about ethical goods isn't easily available.
This statistic illustrates the quarterly penetration rate of the Apple iPhone in Great Britain from the first quarter of 2011 to the third quarter of 2018. The penetration rate peaked at 40 percent in the second quarter of 2017.
This statistic shows the number of cars sold by Ford in France between 2009 and 2018. French sales of Ford cars fluctuated over this period, peaking at 84.4 thousand units sold in 2017. In 2018, Ford sold approximately 81.6 thousand cars, a decrease of roughly 23 percent in comparison with the previous year.
This statistic shows the number of suspects arrested by U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration agents in 2014, by type of drug. In 2014, 5,582 people were arrested for cocaine use in the United States.
This statistic shows the unemployment rate in Swaziland, officially the Kingdom of Eswatini, from 1999 to 2020. In 2020, the estimated unemployment rate among the total labor force inswaziland was at approximately 21.97 percent.

This statistic shows the total music market revenue in Canada from 2011 to 2018. In 2018, Canada's music market generated a total revenue of 510.03 million Canadian dollars, up from 485.78 million a year earlier.
This statistic shows the Seattle Mariners all-time games played leaders as of October 2020. Edgar Martinez has played the most games in Seattle Mariners franchise history with 2,055 games.
At the end of fiscal year 2018, the total area of cultivation for food grains across India was around 127 million hectares. This was an increase of over three percent in the area of production compared to the previous fiscal year. During fiscal year 2019, the south Asian country was the third largest producer of rice in the world.
This statistic shows the volume index of all retail sales (quantity bought) monthly in Great Britain from January 2015 to November 2020, as an index of sales per week. The figures are seasonally adjusted estimates, measured using the Retail Sales Index (RSI) and published in index form with a reference year of 2016 equal to 100. Over the time period observed, sales volume index oscillated, peaking at 105.2 index points in November 2020.
The statistic shows the infant mortality rate in Barbados from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, the infant death rate in the Barbados was at about 11.7 deaths per 1,000 live births.
This statistic shows the economic losses due to major droughts worldwide from 1900 to 2016*. The United States suffered from a drought in June 2012 which caused an economic loss of 20 billion U.S. dollars.
Primary education in Sweden is administered by the municipalities and consists of nine years of compulsory education. The primary school is divided into three years: elementary school, middle school, and high school. In 2018, the expenditure on primary education amounted to 112,200 Swedish kronor per pupil.
This statistic shows the number of Starbucks restaurants in Poland from 2009 to 2019. The number of restaurants decreased from three in 2009 to 73 in 2019.
This statistic shows Glanbia's revenue from 2016 to 2019, by segment. In 2019, the Swiss-based company generated a total revenue of approximately 1.38 billion euros through its Global Performance Nutrition segment.
This statistic shows the mobile internet usage share of leading mobile browsers in Germany from January 2009 to September 2020. In September 2020, roughly 55.25 percent of mobile internet users accessed Chrome on their mobile device.

This statistic presents the percentage of students in the United States who were cyber bullied, sorted by household income. During the school year 2012-13, 7.4 percent of students living in households with an annual income of 50,000 U.S. dollars or more reported that they had been cyber bullied. Cyber bullying includes unwanted contact by threatening or insulting the respondent via digital communications.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Venezuela from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Venezuelan population was 27.3 years.

The south Asian country's transport sector accounted for a 4.85 percent share of the GVA with road transport accounting for over three percent of it. The GVA from railways was about 0.7 percent and air transport accounted for about 0 percent during the same time period.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Ecuador from 1985 to 2018, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per person in Ecuador amounted to around 6,418.48 U.S. dollars.

Retail prices index is a measure of inflation published monthly by the Office for National Statistics. It measures the change in the cost of a representative sample of retail goods and services.

The statistic shows the average inflation rate in France from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the average cost of groceries in France was about 1.3 percent compared to the previous year.

In 2016, it was estimated that more than 51 percent of the income generated in the Dominican Republic was held by the richest 20 percent of its population. This share has been continuously increasing since 2010, when it amounted to 52.9 percent. The level of wealth concentration was also high among other Latin American countries.
As of January 7, 2021, Hungary conducted 24,290 tests for the coronavirus (COVID-19) as of the same date. The highest number of tests conducted in one day was recorded on July 4, 2020, at 7,752.  For further information about the pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
The statistic shows the size of fiscal packages announced by G20 countries and Poland in response to the financial and COVID-19 crisis in 2009 and 2020, as a percentage of Gross Domestic Product (GDP). In the case of the financial crisis, Japan is expected to have the largest fiscal package in 2020 with a share of 19.5 percent. For further information about the coronavirus pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
This statistic shows the median age of the population in Lebanon from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015,the median age the population of Lebanon was 27.6 years.
This statistic shows the workstation occupancy rate of International Workplace Group (IWG), formerly Regus, worldwide from 2012 to 2019, by region. In 2019, IWG's Americas region had an occupancy rate that was 74.8 percent. Regus changed its holding company to IWM but hold the Regus name as their brand.
The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Kuwait from 1985 to 2018, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per person in Kuwait amounted to around 30,442.12 U.S. dollars.

The U.S. presidential election has been contested in Ohio on 33 occasions since 1804, and Ohio has correctly voted for the winning candidate in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Ohio has always voted for a major party candidate, and in the past four elections, Ohio has voted for either of the major parties. The only times where Ohio did not vote for a third party candidate were in 1864 and 1864, where the Whig Party won the majority of the popular vote. In the 2020 election, Donald Trump carried the state with a twenty percent margin over the Democratic nominee, and was

The statistic shows the inflation rate in the Euro area from August 2019 to August 2020. In August 2020, the cost of living increased by 0.2 percent compared to the same month of the previous year. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes.
The 800 meter race has been a permanent fixture in the men's Olympic schedule since 1896, while the women's event was introduced in 1996. The men's event has been included in all Olympic Games since 1948, with the Olympic record set in 1988 at 103.55 seconds. The Olympic record for men was set in 1996 at 102.58 seconds, and the world record for women was set at 115.28 seconds in 1988.

It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. This graph shows the total amount of money spent by super PACs against candidates in the 2012 election, by state. Super PACs are independent expenditure-only committees, which may raise unlimited sums of money from corporations, unions, associations, and individuals, then spend unlimited sums to overtly advocate for or against political candidates. However, direct coordination and communication between political candidates and super PACs is prohibited. Each of the GOP candidates is supported by at least one super PAC. Each GOP candidate is backed by a super PAC, which is independent from the Democratic Party. Each super PAC has a budget of at least 100,000 U.S. dollars

The infant mortality rate in the United States, for children under the age of one year old, was 61 deaths per thousand births in 1935. This means that for all babies born in 1935, over 54 percent did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, and the rate has dropped to its lowest point ever in 2020 where it is just six deaths every thousand births.

Ecuador is among the Latin American countries whose most affected economies by the COVID-19 pandemic. The tourism sector in Ecuador is estimated to experience losses of 150 million U.S. dollars if the country's tourism halt for one month or two months as a result of the crisis caused by the virus outbreak. In the worst case scenario, the tourism sector could be forced to close down for three months, with losses amounting to 540 million dollars. This statistic presents data on the degree of inequality in wealth distribution based on the Gini coefficient in Chile between 2000 and 2017. This coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of equality. As of 2017, Chile had an index of 46.6, an improvement from 52.1 as of 2012.

The U.S. presidential election has been contested in Arizona on 33 occasions, with Arizona correctly voting for the winning candidate in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. In the past four elections, Arizona has voted for the overall winner in 33 elections, with Joe Biden carrying the state with the support of eleven percent of the voters. Arizona has always voted for a major party candidate, and in 2020, the Republican nominee won the popular vote in all elections except 1964 and 1992.

As of December 7, 2020, the OPEC basket stood at some 47.77 U.S. dollars per barrel, while the WTI crude oil price stood at 45.76 U.s. dollars. The OPEC basket is a weighted average of oil prices assigned by OPEC countries based on their crude oil prices. The price of crude oil is based on three main pillars: oil prices, market capitalization, and supply and demand. OPEC stands for “Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries,” and is the world’s largest crude oil market. The “OPEC” crude oil benchmark

This statistic shows the results of a survey conducted in the United States in March 2017, by age. In total, 26 percent of respondents aged 18 to 29 years stated that they regularly used such an app.
This statistic shows the share of grill ownership in the United States in 2020, by type of grill. During the survey, 61 percent of the respondents stated that they owned a gas grill.
This statistic shows the average prices of Enbrel in selected countries in 2017. In that year, the United States sold some 4,440 U.S. dollars worth of the oil and natural gas company's pipeline fuel.
Democrat and Republican parties competed for the U.S. presidential election in the 1860s, and the Democratic Party emerged as the most powerful political party in the nineteenth century. After the American Civil War, the Democrats gained control of the House of Representatives in the 1870s, however the Republican Party lost the presidency in the 1880s and 1890s, before gaining control of Congress in the 1910s. In the 2020 election, the Republicans gained 56.88 percent of the electoral college votes.
This statistic shows the median age of the population in Gabon from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Gabon population was 22.3 years.
The statistic presents information on the PC online games revenue in Vietnam from 2012 to 2014. In 2014, the revenue amounted to 291 million U.S. dollars.
The statistic shows Chicago Bulls players with the most steals in franchise history. Michael Jordan is the career steals leader of the Chicago Bulls with 2,253 steals.
In light of the coronavirus outbreak, the forecast for Denmark's GDP growth in 2020 and 2021 changed from 4.4 percent in 2020 to minus 7.5 percent in 2021. The GDP growth was forecasted to decrease by 2.8 percent by 2021.  The first case of COVID-19 in Denmark was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronava pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

This statistic shows the population change in Ivory Coast from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, Ivory Coast's population increased by approximately 2.55 percent compared to the previous year.

Life expectancy in Afghanistan was 28.2 in the year 1800, and over the course of the next 220 years, it is expected to have increased to 64.3 by the year 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout Afghanistan's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were because of the Spanish Flu pandemic of the late-1910s, and the Second World War.
This statistic shows the religious affiliations of the population in Japan in 2017. In 2017, about 70.4 percent of the Japanese population claimed to be of Shintoism.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in Morocco from 1985 to 2018, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2018, the GDP per person in Morocco amounted to around 3,348.14 U.S. dollars.
In 2018, spending on education represented nearly 16.9 percent of Peru's total government expenditure, down from 18.24 percent a year earlier. Expenditure on education has been continuously increasing in the South American country since 2010, when it accounted for 13.56 percent of the country's GDP.

Chiapas is the only Mexican state where extreme poverty is defined as the state of one who lacks a certain amount of material possessions or money. Many professional soccer leagues across the globe suspended their seasons and hundreds of thousands of jobs were put at risk as public sporting events were cancelled or postponed in order to mitigate the spread of the disease. During the lockdown imposed by the UK government in response to the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, like-for-like sales of pub, bar and restaurant groups in Great Britain fell by 56.4 percent in March 2020 compared to the same period the previous year. This was due to the issuing of the warning on March 9-15, which had a cumulative effect of 14.6 percent decline in sales. In response to this, bars and restaurants were advised to close their doors and close all outlets. In contrast, sales of restaurants were expected to decrease by 56,4 percent.  For further
This statistic shows the prospects of investment and development in hotel real estate in Europe from 2018 to 2020. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. This statistic depicts the largest Accountable Care Organizations (ACOs) in the U.S. based on number of members as of 2016. At that time, the Banner Health Network was the largest ACO with 46,000 members.
At the end of fiscal year 2019, the length of national highways across the Indian state of Jharkhand was around 3.4 thousand kilometers. The highways were one of the largest in the world. The south Asian country ranked first out of 200 reported in World Road Statistics that year for the number of road deaths.
The statistic shows the number of Twitter followers of the Major League Baseball franchise New York Yankees from September 2011 to October 2020. In October 2020, the Twitter account of the New York Giants had around 3.4 million followers.
The Gini coefficient measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households in a given country from a perfectly equal distribution. A value of 0 represents absolute equality, whereas 100 would be the highest possible degree of inequality. In 2018, the Gini index in Finland was 27.4 percent.
This graph shows the percentage of votes of the 2016 presidential elections in the United States on November 9, 2016, by party affiliation. According to the exit polls, 89 percent of Democrats voted for Hillary Clinton.
This statistic shows the minimum Arctic sea ice extent from September 2007 to September 2020*. In September 2020, an estimated 3.74 million square kilometers of sea ice were covered by the arctic sea ice.
This statistic presents the number of monetary financial credit institutions (MFIs) in Belgium from December 2008 to December 2019. At the end of 2019, there were 85 FIs in Belgium.
The statistic shows the consumption of cement in China from 2006 to 2016. In 2016, approximately 2.33 billion metric tons of cement were consumed in China.
This statistic shows the age structure in Sweden from 2009 to 2019. In 2019, about 17.63 percent of Sweden's total population were aged 0 to 14 years.
The statistic shows the penetration rate of unique mobile subscribers worldwide from 2000 to 2020. In the first quarter of 2020, the global mobile subscriber penetration rate was 72 percent.

This statistic shows the total number of adventure sport motorcycles sold in the United Kingdom (UK) between July 2016 and July 2020. As with other vehicles, sales tend to spike in March and September due to the release of new registrations. This also explains the lower sales in February.
The infant mortality rate in the Netherlands, for children under the age of one year old, was 164 deaths per thousand births in 1840. This means that for all babies born in 1840, approximately one in every three did not make it to their first birthday. Over the course of the next 220 years, this number has dropped drastically, particularly in the first half of the twentieth century, and the rate has dropped to its lowest point ever in 2020 where it is just three deaths every thousand births.
Between 2014 and 2019, the number of mono-brand stores of the Italian fashion company Geox increased constantly. In 2019, Geox operated 272 stores in Italy, 270 stores in Europe and 37 stores in North America.
The statistic illustrates the monthly interest rates on auto loans in the United States from January 2014 to November 2020. In November 2020, the interest rate on the auto loans amounted to 4.22 percent.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in the Dominican Republic from 1950 to 2050. The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median old of the Republic's population was 26.5 years.

According to a survey conducted to understand the level of fear about contracting the coronavirus (COVID-19) among Indians in March 2020, about 29 percent of respondents stated that they were very scared of contracting the virus. This was followed by the Gen Z group at 26 percent. On the other hand, about 21 percent of the respondents belonging to the Baby Boomers stated to be very scared.  India went into lockdown on March 25, 2020, the largest in the world, restricting 1.3 billion people, extended until May 3, 2020. The lockdown was triggered due to the growing number of people who were infected
Delaware has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1789, and has correctly voted for the nationwide winner in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. Delaware has always voted for a major party candidate, and in the past forty elections, Delaware has voted for either of the major parties in every election except the nineteenth and early twentieth centuries. In the most recent election, Joe Biden carried the state with a twenty percent margin in the popular vote, and was thus the clear victor in the 2020 election. Although Delaware did not take part in the nineteenth century, this was due to the
This statistic shows the results of a survey on religious identification in Sweden in 2017, by type. According to the survey, the largest share of Swedish respondents were church-attending Christians, with a total of nine percent. The second largest group of respondents (43 percent) were non-practicing Christians, followed by 42 percent of the population.
How many overnight stays were there in Denmark before and after the coronavirus outbreak? The number of overnight stays fluctuated over the period from March to August 2020, but there was a decrease in the number of nights spent in hotels and hostels. In March 2020, there were over 1.8 million overnight stays in hotels, while in August 2020 there were roughly 167 thousand overnight stays.  The first case of COVID-19 in Denmark was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronava pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, the median population of Jamaica was 29 years.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) per capita in the United States from 1985 to 2019, with projections up until 2025. GDP is the total value of all goods and services produced in a country in a year. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the GDP per capita amounted to 65,253.52 U.S. dollars.

Between February and March 2020, newspapers and magazines were the most affected by the virus in the country. Moreover, television and radio followed with over 86 percent of the total number of cases.  The first case of the virus was confirmed on February 4, 2020 in Rome. For further information about the coronavidus (SARS-CoV-2) pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.

Furthermore, 48 percent of them watched movies and television shows on OTT platforms.  The country went into a lockdown on March 25, 2020, the largest in the world, restricting 1.3 billion people.  For further information about the pandemic, please visit our dedicated Fact and Figures page.

The statistic shows the trend-indicator-value (TIV) of the export of arms from Norway in 2018, by country. The TIV is based on the known unit production costs of a core set of weapons and is intended to represent the transfer of military resources rather than the financial value of the transfer.  In 2018, arms export from Norway to the United States totaled to 44 million constant (1990) U.S. dollars. The depicted export value is only an indicator and does not correspond to the actual financial results of the transfers.

This statistic shows the monthly percentage of change in the Producer Price Index for intermediate goods in the United States from December 2012 to December 2013. The PPI is a measure of inflation published monthly by the Bureau of Labor Statistics. It is based on the known unit production costs of finished products and is intended to represent the final cost of those finished. In December 2013, the PPI increased by 0.6 percent compared to the previous month.

As of the date of survey, Denmark had the highest number of tests per 1,000 people, followed by Iceland with 662.72 and Norway with 460.32 per thousand people, respectively.  The first case of the virus in Denmark was confirmed on February 27, 2020. For further information about the coronavidus pandemic, please visit our dedicated Facts and Figures page.
In 2019, about four percent of married-couple families in the United States were living below the poverty level.  Poverty is the state of one who lacks a certain amount of material possessions or money. Absolute poverty or destitution is inability to afford basic human needs, which commonly includes clean and fresh water, nutrition, health care, education, clothing, and shelter.

The statistic shows the Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation rate in selected European countries in 2019. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In 2019, the CPI rate in Greece was at 0.5 percent.

The statistic illustrates the inflation rate for the Consumer Price Index (CPI) in the United Kingdom (UK) from January 1989 to November 2020. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. Inflation is reported by the Office for National Statistics (ONS).

This statistic displays the annual exchange rate (average or standardized measure) of the euro to the U.S. dollar (EUR USD), according to data from the European Central Bank, from January 1999 to October 2020. The average, or standardized, measure shows the calculation based on many observations throughout the period in question, which is different than an annual measure at point in time: this denotes concrete values as of the last day of each month. Between the months of January and March 2020, the average exchange rate of one euro to one dollar noted a steep increase.

The statistic shows gross domestic product (GDP) in Nepal from 1984 to 2019, with projections up until 2021. GDP refers to the total market value of all goods and services that are produced within a country per year. It is an important indicator of the economic strength of a country. In 2019, Nepal's GDP amounted to around 94.38 billion international dollars.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in Tunisia from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015,the median age the population of Tunisia was 31.3 years.
Life expectancy in China was 32 years in 1850, and over the course of the next 145 years, it is expected to have increased to 76.62 years by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout China's history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. These changes were a result of the First World War and the Second World War, both of which were caused by the Chinese Revolution.

This statistic shows the Weighted Index* of social justice in OECD member countries in 2011. The Index is a weighted index that measures the deviation of the distribution of income (or consumption) among individuals or households according to their level of social activity (income, consumption expenditure, etc.). The weighted index is equal to the sum of the following (total) components: social justice, health care, education, and welfare. In 2011, Turkey had the highest index score with an index value of 3.85.

A brand is defined here as the trademark and associated intellectual property. Football clubs are made up of a mixture of fixed tangible assets (stadium, training ground) and disclosed intangible assets (purchased players) with brand value.To calculate brand values the Royalty Relief method was used. This approach assumes the company doesn't own their brand and must license it from a theoretical third party. The method determines how much

Wisconsin has taken part in all U.S. presidential elections since 1848, and has correctly voted for the winning candidate in 33 of these elections, giving a success rate of 73 percent. In the 1892 election, Wisconsin's only non-Republican win came in the 1912 election, where the Progressive Party candidate won the state with a twenty percent margin. Wisconsin has always voted for a major party candidate, and in 2020, Joe Biden carried the state by a comfortable margin in the popular vote.

This statistic shows the median age of the population in South Africa from 1950 to 2050*.The median age is the age that divides a population into two numerically equal groups; that is, half the people are younger than this age and half are older. It is a single index that summarizes the age distribution of a population. In 2015, South Africa's median age was 26.4 years.

This statistic shows the Consumer Price Index (CPI) of urban consumers in the United States from 1992 to 2019. The CPI is an inflation-adjusted measure that measures the change in the price of everything consumers buy in the given time period. It is considered to be a very important indicator of the economic strength of a country and a positive change is an indicator of economic growth. In 2019, the CPI for urban consumers was 255.66.

The statistic illustrates the inflation rate for food in the United Kingdom (UK) from March 2015 to July 2020. The inflation rate is calculated using the price increase of a defined product basket. This product basket contains products and services, on which the average consumer spends money throughout the year. They include expenses for groceries, clothes, rent, power, telecommunications, recreational activities and raw materials (e.g. gas, oil), as well as federal fees and taxes. In July 2020, the cost of food increased by 0.8 percent.

In 2019, Venezuela was ranked as the country with the sixth highest risk index of money laundering and terrorist financing in Latin America, with an index score of 5.72, down from 5.69 the year before. This signifies a decrease in the risk index value of over nine percent against the previous year.  The Basel AML Index is a composite index, a combination of 14 different indicators with regards to corruption, financial standards, political disclosure and rule of law and tries to measure the risk level in different countries. The numbers used are based on publicly available sources such as the FATF, Transparency International, the World Bank

This statistic shows the top 20 super PAC donors in support of U.S. presidential candidates, as of 8 February 2016. Super PACs are independent expenditure-only committees, which may raise unlimited sums of money from corporations, unions, associations and individuals, then spend unlimited sums to overtly advocate for or against political candidates. However, direct coordination and communication between political candidates and super PACs is prohibited.

More than 53 percent of the respondents said they would pay less for biodegradable plastic products. As of March 2020, more than 60 percent of people surveyed in Brazil said that they could work from home during the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak. On the other hand, only 25 percent of respondents earning more than 10 times the minimum wage said they could do so at home over ten times the monthly minimum wage. Meanwhile, 75 percent of Brazilians working from home stated that they were unable to work at home due to the outbreak of the virus. On March 25, 2020, the president of Brazil, Jair Bolsonaro, announced that Brazil would increase the minimum monthly wage by 2.5

Life expectancy in the United States was 39.4 in 1860, and over the course of the next 150 years, it is expected to have increased to 78.8 by 2020. Although life expectancy has generally increased throughout U.S. history, there were several times where the rate deviated from its previous trajectory. The most noticeable changes were because of the Spanish Flu pandemic of the late-1910s, and the Second World War.
